p: Based on analysed chemical composition ( table 1), both control and test foods met the AAFCO minimum recommendations for essential amino acid content. The most limiting essential amino acid (determined by dividing amino acid concentration in g/100 kcal by the AAFCO value in g/100 kcal for that amino acid) was threonine; control food was 13 per cent higher than AAFCO minimum recommendations, and test food was 50 per cent higher than AAFCO minimum recommendations.
